1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdUname.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	Provides fast aquisition of the information available**
14   |  **			via uname.  This shows a 10x improvement over having **
15   |  **			to exec the actual uname program from within a	     **
16   |  **			modulefile.					     **
17   |  ** 									     **
18   |  **   Exports:		cmdUname					     **
19   |  ** 									     **
20   |  **   Notes:								     **
21   |  ** 									     **
22   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
23   |  ****/
24   | 
25   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
26   |  ** 									     **
27   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
28   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
29   |  ** 									     ** 
30   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
31   | 
32   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdUname.c.src.html,v 1.9 2009/09/02 20:37:40 rkowen Exp $";
33   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
34   | 
35   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
36   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
37   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
38   | 
39   | #include "modules_def.h"
40   | 
41   | #ifdef HAVE_UNAME
42   | #  include <sys/utsname.h>
43   | #else
44   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
45   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
46   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
47   | typedef	struct	utsname {
48   | 	char	sysname[ NAMELEN];	/** System name			     **/
49   | 	char	nodename[ NAMELEN];	/** Node name			     **/
50   | 	char	release[ NAMELEN];	/** OS Release			     **/
51   | 	char	version[ NAMELEN];	/** OS Version			     **/
52   | 	char	machine[ NAMELEN];	/** Machine type		     **/
53   | } UTS_NAME;
54   | #endif
55   | 
56   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
57   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
58   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
59   | 
60   | /** not applicable **/
61   | 
62   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
63   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
64   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
65   | 
66   | #define	NAMELEN		(8 + 1)		/** 8 chars + 1 terminator	     **/
67   | #define	DOMAINLEN	(64 + 1)	/** 8 chars + 1 terminator	     **/
68   | 
69   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
70   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
71   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
72   | 
73   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
74   | 
75   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
76   | static	char	_proc_cmdUname[] = "cmdUname";
77   | #endif
78   | 
79   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
80   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
81   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
82   | 
83   | /** not applicable **/
84   | 
85   | 
86   | /*++++
87   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
88   |  ** 									     **
89   |  **   Function:		cmdUname					     **
90   |  ** 									     **
91   |  **   Description:	Callback function for  the commands 'sysname',	     **
92   |  **			'nodename', 'release', 'version' and 'machine'       **
93   |  ** 									     **
94   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
95   |  ** 									     **
96   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
97   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
98   |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
99   |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument array	     **
100  |  ** 									     **
101  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
102  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
103  |  ** 									     **
104  |  **   Attached Globals:	flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
105  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
106  |  **					control everything		     **
107  |  ** 									     **
108  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
109  |  ++++*/
110  | 
111  | int	cmdUname(	ClientData	 client_data,
112  | 	  		Tcl_Interp	*interp,
113  | 	  		int		 argc,
114  | 	  		CONST84 char	*argv[])
115  | {
116  |     int  length;
117  | #ifdef PHOSTNAME
118  | #  ifndef HAVE_GETHOSTNAME
119  |     FILE* hname;
120  | #  endif
121  | #endif
122  |     char	domain[ DOMAINLEN];
123  |     int		namestruct_init = 0;
124  | #ifdef HAVE_UNAME
125  |     struct utsname	namestruct;
126  | #else
127  |     UTS_NAME		namestruct;
128  |     strncat(namestruct.sysname ,_(em_unknown),NAMELEN);
129  |     strncat(namestruct.nodename,_(em_unknown),NAMELEN);
130  |     strncat(namestruct.release ,_(em_unknown),NAMELEN);
131  |     strncat(namestruct.version ,_(em_unknown),NAMELEN);
132  |     strncat(namestruct.machine ,_(em_unknown),NAMELEN);
133  | #endif
134  | 
135  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
136  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_cmdUname, NULL);
137  | #endif
138  | 
139  |     /**
140  |      **  Parameter check. One parameter should be given providing a selector
141  |      **  do differ between:
142  |      **/
143  | 
144  |     if( argc != 2) {
145  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_USAGE, LOC, argv[0], "member", NULL))
146  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
147  |     }
148  | 
149  | #ifdef HAVE_UNAME
150  |     /**
151  |      **  Process the system call
152  |      **/
153  |     if( !namestruct_init && uname( &namestruct) < 0) {
154  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_UNAME, LOC, NULL))
155  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
156  |     }
157  | 
158  | #else /* not HAVE_UNAME */
159  | 
160  |     /**
161  |      **  If we do not have the uname system call, fixed values defined 
162  |      **  at compile time will be returned. The only differenc is the
163  |      **  nodename, which may be seeked for using 'gethostname' or the
164  |      **  PHOSTNAME file.
165  |      **/
166  | 
167  | #  ifdef HAVE_GETHOSTNAME
168  | 
169  |     if( -1 == gethostname( namestruct.nodename, NAMELEN)) 
170  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_GETHOSTNAME, LOC, NULL))
171  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
172  | 
173  | #  else /* not HAVE_GETHOSTNAME */
174  | 
175  | #    ifdef PHOSTNAME
176  | 
177  |     if( NULL == (hname = popen( PHOSTNAME, "r"))) {
178  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_POPEN, LOC, PHOSTNAME,
179  | 	    _(em_reading), NULL))
180  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
181  |     }
182  | 
183  |     fgets( namestruct.nodename, NAMELEN, hname);
184  |     namestruct.nodename[ strlen( namestruct.nodename)-1] = '\0';
185  | 
186  |     if( -1 == pclose( hname))
187  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_PCLOSE, LOC, PHOSTNAME, NULL))
188  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
189  | 
190  | #    endif /* not PHOSTNAME */
191  | #  endif /* not HAVE_GETHOSTNAME */
192  | 
193  | #endif /* not HAVE_UNAME */
194  |  
195  |     /**
196  |      **  Set up the domain name
197  |      **/
198  | #ifdef HAVE_GETDOMAINNAME
199  |     if( !namestruct_init)
200  |         if( -1 == getdomainname( domain, DOMAINLEN))
201  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_GETDOMAINNAME, LOC, NULL))
202  | 		return( TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
203  | #else
204  |     strncat(domain, _(em_unknown), DOMAINLEN);
205  | #endif
206  | 
207  |     /**
208  |      **  Now the name structure surely IS initialized
209  |      **/
210  | 
211  |     namestruct_init = 1;
212  | 
213  |     /**
214  |      **  Return the selected value
215  |      **/
216  | 
217  |     length = strlen( argv[1]);
218  | 
219  |     if( !strncmp( argv[1], "sysname", length)) {
220  |         Tcl_SetResult( interp, namestruct.sysname, TCL_VOLATILE);
221  |     } else if( !strncmp( argv[1], "nodename", length)) {
222  |         Tcl_SetResult( interp, namestruct.nodename, TCL_VOLATILE);
223  |     } else if( !strncmp( argv[1], "release", length)) {
224  |         Tcl_SetResult( interp, namestruct.release, TCL_VOLATILE);
225  |     } else if( !strncmp( argv[1], "version", length)) {
226  |         Tcl_SetResult( interp, namestruct.version, TCL_VOLATILE);
227  |     } else if( !strncmp( argv[1], "machine", length)) {
228  |         Tcl_SetResult( interp, namestruct.machine, TCL_VOLATILE);
229  |     } else if( !strncmp( argv[1], "domain", length)) {
230  |         Tcl_SetResult( interp, domain, TCL_VOLATILE);
231  |     } else {
232  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_USAGE, LOC, argv[0], "{sysname|nodename|"
233  | 	    "release|version|machine|domain}", NULL))
234  | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
235  |     }
236  | 
237  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
238  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_cmdUname, NULL);
239  | #endif
240  | 
241  |     return( TCL_OK);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
242  | 
243  | } /** End of 'cmdUname' **/
